CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Cowan, 317 Hampton Street, Chattanooga, Tennessee, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 25, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that business and employment are as good as the Eisenhower administration declares that it is?" answer reads: "Frankly, no. We all see so many things closing down and people being laid off.  Last year, it was very bad because so many people were out of work.  The employment is down and so is business."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Cowan wearing floppy scalloped edged hat and eyeglasses, standing on sidewalk with automobiles and buildings in background
